short_description: fastpath function with an intermediate step to polynomialfeaturestransform, which helps the user to store all the values provided in the argument in the form of a table.
long_description: fastpath function with an intermediate step to polynomialfeaturestransform, which helps the user to store all the values provided in the argument in the form of a table.

input_tables.name: InputTable
input_tables.rDescription: The relation that contains input data.
input_tables.description: The relation that contains input data.

output_tables.name: OutputTable
output_tables.rDescription: Specifies the name of the table where the function stores the result from the function
output_tables.description: Specifies the name of the table where the function stores the result from the function

argument_clauses.name: TargetColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the input table columns for which polynomial features needs to be generated.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input table columns for which polynomial features needs to be generated.

argument_clauses.name: IncludeBias
argument_clauses.rDescription: It adds an extra bias column one, which acts as an intercept term in a linear model
argument_clauses.description: It adds an extra bias column one, which acts as an intercept term in a linear model

argument_clauses.name: InteractionOnly
argument_clauses.rDescription: If true, features that are products of at most degree distinct input features are only produced
argument_clauses.description: If true, features that are products of at most degree distinct input features are only produced

argument_clauses.name: Degree
argument_clauses.rDescription: degree upto which polynomial features between TargetColumns are imputed.
argument_clauses.description: degree upto which polynomial features between TargetColumns are imputed.
